sen.j: 熊野国造（くまののくにのみやつこ、くまのこくそう）とは、熊野国（後の紀伊国牟婁郡、現在の和歌山県南部と三重県南部）を古代に支配した氏族。
sen.e: Kumanokuni no miyatsuko (Kumano kokuso) was shizoku (clan) who ruled Kumano Province (later Muro-gun, Kii Province, present Southern area of Wakayama Prefecture and Southern area of Mie Prefecture) in ancient times.

sen.cmt: 人名を大文字にしました。

sen.j: ニギハヤヒ（にぎはやひのみこと）の後裔、大阿刀足尼（おおあとのすくね）が成務天皇の代に熊野国造となり、その子・稲比が熊野直（くまののあたえ）の姓（かばね）を賜ったという。
sen.e: It was said that the descendant of Nigihayahi (Nigihayahi no mikoto), OOATO no Sukune became Kumanokuni no miyatsuko in the era of the Emperor Seimu and his child Inehi was given kabane (hereditary title) of Kumano no atae.
sen.cmt: 「稲比」の読み方が不明ですが、推測で「いねひ」と訳しました。
sen.e: It was said that the descendant of Nigihayahi (Nigihayahi no mikoto), OOATO no Sukune became Kumanokuni no miyatsuko in the era of the Emperor Seimu and his child Inehi was given kabane (hereditary title) of Kumano no atae.

sen.j: 『新撰姓氏録』山城（神別・天神）には熊野連〔饒速日命孫味饒田命之後也〕と見える。
sen.e: According to "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) Yamashiro (Shinbetsu, Tenjin), the kabane was Kumano no muraji [descendant of Umashinigita no mikoto who was grandchild of Nigihayahi no mikoto].
sen.cmt: 「饒速日命孫味饒田命之後也」は、「饒速日命(にぎはやひのみこと)の孫・味饒田命(うましにぎたのみこと)の後裔」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: According to "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) Yamashiro (Shinbetsu, Tenjin), the kabane was Kumano no muraji [descendant of Umashinigita no mikoto who was grandchild of Nigihayahi no mikoto].

sen.j: 熊野国が紀伊国に編入されてからは牟婁郡大領、また熊野本宮禰宜の職に就き、代々本宮を奉斎した。
sen.e: After Kumano Province was incorporated into Kii Province, the clan served as Dairyo (high-ranking local magistrate) of Muro-gun as well as Negi (Shinto priest) of Kumano-hongu Shrine and consecrated hongu (main shrine) for generations.

sen.j: 神職としては、中央の後盾のあった熊野別当の勢力に圧された。
sen.e: As Shinto priest, the clan was overwhelmed by the power of Kumano betto (title of an official who administered the shrines at Kumano) having the backing of the central government.
sen.cmt: 「中央」は「中央政権」と解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: やがて国造家は和田庄司（和田国造）を称するようになり、子孫は土豪として紀伊国全域、河内国などに勢力を持った。
sen.e: Later, the Kuni no miyatsuko family called themselves Wada Shoji (Wadakuni no miyatsuko) and the descendants had the power as a powerful local clan over the whole area in Kii province, Kawachi Province and so on.

Later, the Kuni no miyatsuko family called themselves Wada Shoji (Wadakuni no miyatsuko) and the descendants became a powerful local clan with strong influence over the whole area in Kii province, Kawachi Province, or in other areas.
sen.cmt: 原文に忠実に訳したためと思われますが、「土豪」の訳と「勢力」の訳で「power」が重なり、文中で連続しますので、「became a powerful local clan with strong influence」としこれを避けました。And so onを修正しました。
sen.e: Later, the Kuni no miyatsuko family called themselves Wada Shoji (Wadakuni no miyatsuko) and the descendants became a powerful local clan with strong influence over the whole area in Kii province, Kawachi Province, or in other areas.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』に、牟漏の采女・熊野直広浜（ひろはま）が聖武天皇の代から称徳天皇の代まで（計4代）仕えたことが見える（神護景雲3年没・従四位下）。
sen.e: According to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Kumano no atae Hirohama, an uneme (a court lady) of Muro, served four generations of emperors, from the Emperor Shomu to the Empress Shotoku (died in 769, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)).

sen.j: 平安時代には、分家の真砂庄司も「真砂の長者」と呼ばれて栄えた。
sen.e: In the Heian period, a branch family Masago shoji also prospered and was called 'choja (millionaire) of Masago'.

sen.j: 清姫伝説では、主人公の女は真砂の庄司清次の娘（古い伝えでは清次の妻あるいは未亡人）とされる。
sen.e: According to the legend of Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo), the woman of main character was said to be a daughter of Seiji of Masago shoji (according to an ancient tradition, Seiji's wife or widow).

According to the legend of Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo), the woman of main character was said to be a daughter of Seiji of Masago shoji (according to an ancient tradition, this is supposed to be Seiji's wife or widow).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明文に仮定の意味を持つフレーズを加え本説明と区別するようにしました。
sen.e: According to the legend of Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo), the woman of main character was said to be a daughter of Seiji of Masago shoji (according to an ancient tradition, this is supposed to be Seiji's wife or widow).

sen.j: 真砂氏は『太平記』などに登場する「熊野八庄司」の一つとなる。
sen.e: The Masago clan became one of 'eight shoji of Kumano' appeared in "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) and so on.
The Masago clan is one of the 'eight shoji of Kumano' appeared in some stories such as "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace).
sen.cmt: 原文の「一つとなる」という言い方が誤解を招いたと思われ、訳者は「became」を用いています。「一つである」で十分意味が伝わると考え修正しました。特定のものを指しますので定冠詞を加えています。また「and so on」は削除し、それに合わせた修正を行ないました。
sen.e: The Masago clan is one of the 'eight shoji of Kumano' appeared in some stories such as "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace).

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)には、河内国の楠木正遠が楠木氏（伊予橘氏）の家系を継承したが、楠木正成一族を除き、他の子息（楠木正季ら）の一族は和田氏に復している。
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), although Masatoo KUSUNOKI of Kawachi Province succeeded to the family line of the Kusunoki clan (the Iyotachibana clan), the family of other sons (Masasue KUSUNOKI and others) reverted to the Wada clan, except the family of Masashige KUSUNOKI.

In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), Masato KUSUNOKI of Kawachi Province succeeded to the family line of the Kusunoki clan (the Iyotachibana clan), while the family of other sons (Masasue KUSUNOKI and others) reverted to the Wada clan, except the family of Masashige KUSUNOKI.
sen.cmt: ローマ字ルールに従い「Masatoo」を「Masato」としました。原文の語順に合わせたため、「althoughー」の文章が「In the period of--」の次に来る不自然な順序なっています。原文では「ーしたが、」と否定を示すかのように書かれているために訳者は「although」を用いていますが、実際には否定の意味はないため削除し、関係のある次の文への接続に「while」を用いました。
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), Masato KUSUNOKI of Kawachi Province succeeded to the family line of the Kusunoki clan (the Iyotachibana clan), while the family of other sons (Masasue KUSUNOKI and others) reverted to the Wada clan, except the family of Masashige KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 南朝 (日本)方の家臣・和田正興は系譜不詳。
sen.e: The family tree of Masaoki WADA who was vassal of the Southern Court (Japan) was unknown.
The family tree of Masaoki WADA, who was vassal of the Southern Court (Japan), is unknown.
sen.cmt: 「who」に始まる挿入文をコンマで区切り、区別しました。「unknonw」の時制を、現在不詳であるという意味から現在形としました。
sen.e: The family tree of Masaoki WADA, who was vassal of the Southern Court (Japan), is unknown.

sen.j: 『太平記』などは和田正興を楠木氏と同族とするが、実際は和泉国の御家人・和田（みきた・にぎた）氏（大中臣氏）の出であったとも考えられる（婚姻関係などにより同族化した可能性はある）。
sen.e: According to "Taiheiki", Masaoki WADA was the same family as the Kusunoki clan, but it is believed that he was actually from the Mikita (Nigita) clan (the Onakatomi clan) who was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Izumi Province (it is possible that he became the same family through marital relation and so on).

According to "Taiheiki", Masaoki WADA was the same family as the Kusunoki clan, but it is also possible that he was actually from the Mikita (Nigita) clan (the Onakatomi clan) who was the gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Izumi Province (it is possible that he became the same family through marital relation).
sen.cmt: 「ーであったとも考えられる」という原文を「it is believed--」としていましたので、「it is also possible」としました。And so onを削除しています。
sen.e: According to "Taiheiki", Masaoki WADA was the same family as the Kusunoki clan, but it is also possible that he was actually from the Mikita (Nigita) clan (the Onakatomi clan) who was the gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Izumi Province (it is possible that he became the same family through marital relation).

sen.j: ただし、国造和田氏の流れを汲む多くの氏族（橋本氏、神宮寺氏など）が南朝 (日本)方に付いて、同族の楠木氏と共に戦った。
sen.e: However, many clans (the Hashimoto clan, the Jinguji clan and so on) that were descended from the Kuni no miyatsuko Wada clan took the side of the Southern Court (Japan) and fought against the Kusunoki clan of the same family.

Still, many clans (the Hashimoto clan, the Jinguji clan and so on) that were descended from the Kuni no miyatsuko Wada clan took the side of the Southern Court (Japan), and fought together with the Kusunoki clan with the same root.
sen.cmt: 最後の「同族の楠氏と共に戦った」を訳者は「同族の楠木氏に対して戦った」と誤訳しています。史実では、南朝の後醍醐方に多くの氏族が参入し、楠木氏もそれに加わっています。このため、原文文頭の「ただし、」は前項にある「太平記では和田真興を楠氏と同族とするが、そうでないという説もある、ただし国造和田氏の流れを汲む楠木氏他の多くの氏族と共に南朝に付いて戦った」という意味を示すためのもので、意味反転の内容の強い「However,」を用いるのを避けました。前項目を引き継ぎつつ、「それでも、」といった接続詞的意味をもつ副詞「Still」を用いています。
sen.e: Still, many clans (the Hashimoto clan, the Jinguji clan and so on) that were descended from the Kuni no miyatsuko Wada clan took the side of the Southern Court (Japan), and fought together with the Kusunoki clan with the same root.
